awd_titl_txt: O2, pH, PCO2 and Carbon Diagenesis in Hemipelagic Sediments
awd_abstract_narration: High rates of organic matter degradation near the sediment-                     water interface together with slow CaCO3 dissolution are                        expected to result in pore waters that are undersaturated with                  respect to calcium carbonate to depths exceeding 57cm in                        heimpelagic sediments.  This hypothesis will be tested by                       determining the effective in situ CaCO3 dissolution rate                        constant and estimating integrated rates of organic carbon and                  CaCO3 regeneration at three stations that underlie the                          California Current westward of Point Conception, California.                    In the first year, the thrust will be to further develop,                       calibrate and test PCO2 and pH micro- electrodes.  Field work                   will be conducted both at the end of the first and the second                   year.

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
